etymologies: mid 17th century; earliest use found in Edward Waterhouse. From drone + -y

definitions: Having the characteristics of a male bee, especially lazy, indolent, sluggish.

etymologies: mid 18th century; earliest use found in Thomas Gray (1716–1771), poet and literary scholar. From either drone or drone + -y

definitions: Characterized by a continuous steady deep humming or buzzing sound, or a monotonous, dull tone.
